alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 8:47AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall may result in pockets of street flooding across portions of Rhode Island and Southeast Massachusetts this morning... At 843 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking cluster of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall across southeast Connecticut, moving northeast at 15 mph. This activity will impact portions of Rhode Island and southeast Massachusetts over the next few hours. This may result in pockets of street flooding across Rhode Island and Southeast Massachusetts. This includes the Providence metro area as well as the typically vulnerable Fall River and New Bedford areas. HAZARD...Pockets of street flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Providence, New Bedford, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Taunton, East Providence, Coventry, Dartmouth, North Providence, South Kingstown, West Warwick, Johnston, Bridgewater, North Kingstown, Bristol, Block Island, Attleboro and Middleborough. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Western Plymouth
